dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 5594 IH: Promoting the Unbiased Role of Employees in the Executive Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Hinson (for herself and Mr. Feenstra) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to establish a 5-year post-employment ban on lobbying by former senior executive branch personnel and to prohibit such personnel from lobbying at any time on behalf of foreign governments or entities controlled by foreign governments, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Promoting the Unbiased Role of Employees in the Executive Act or the PURE Executive Act.

section.header: 5-year post-employment ban on lobbying by former senior executive branch personnel

subsection.text: Section 207 of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (c)(1), by striking within 1 year after the termination and inserting within 5 years after the termination; and
in subsection (d)(1), by striking within 2 years after the termination and inserting within 5 years after the termination.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to any individual who, on or after the date of the enactment of this Act, leaves a position to which subsection (c) or (d) of section 207 of title 18, United States Code, applies.

section.header: Lifetime ban on lobbying by former senior executive branch personnel on behalf of foreign governments or entities owned or controlled by foreign governments

subsection.text: Section 207(f) of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraph (3) as paragraph (4); and
by inserting after paragraph (2) the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Special rule for senior personnel of the executive branch and independent agencies
paragraph.text: In the case of an individual who is subject to the restrictions of subsection (c) or (d), the restrictions described in paragraph (1) shall apply to representing, aiding, or advising a foreign entity, or representing, aiding, or advising any entity which is subject to the direction, ownership, control, or influence of a foreign entity, at any time after the individual leaves a position to which such subsection applies.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to any individual who, on or after the date of the enactment of this Act, leaves a position to which subsection (c) or (d) of section 207 of title 18, United States Code, applies.
